page.title: 06 SUTTON MILL DAM FROM 1960
page.content: The water level in Sutton Mill Dam was gradually going down over the years. The dirt and sand from the side of the dam had been washed down and had settled on the bottom of the dam. Eventually the dirt and sand grew further until there was hardly any water left. In the early 1960's this was made worse by subsidence at the head of Sutton Mill Dam. This meant that the dams held even less water. By the time British Sidac closed down in 1982 the series of dams were used only as reserves for washing and fire-fighting. The main water supply for the production process was piped underground from Carr Mill Dam.
